intro: Anthemis ammanthus subsp. paleacea, commonly known as the paleacean anthemis, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in the Mediterranean. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens or dry landscapes. Its botanical structure reflects adaptations to its arid or semi-arid habitats, with a compact growth form and drought-resistant properties.
